CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: To investigate the morphology of the polymer / PCBM blend film , atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was performed , and the result is shown in Figure 6. In Figure 6a , microphase separation occurred between the polymer and PC71BM , while the polymer formed a small fibril - type domain at a 1 : 1 PQCDTB / PC71BM ratio. As shown in Figure 6c , the fibril domain or microphase separation was clearer when measured at a 1 × 1 μm 2 size. It appears that this type of fibril domain occurred because PQCDTB formed effective π-π stacking based on outstanding crystallinity. 31 As shown in Figure 6b , in contrast , when the PQCDTB / PC71BM ratio was 1 : 2 , the polymers were assembled , and a large domain was formed. As a result , a relatively large - size phase separation took place. As shown in Figure 6d , the large domain or the large - size phase separation was clearer when measured at a 1 × 1 μm 2 size. The large - phase separation exhibits a low photocurrent by reducing the charge separation and increasing the exciton diffusion length and the recombination of electric charges. 32 Therefore , at a 1 : 2 polymer / PC71BM ratio , a large phase separation occurs between the polymer and the PC71BM. As a result , a low photocurrent would occur ; this is comparable to the 1 : 1 ratio. The same results were confirmed for the current device using the data in Table 3. Similar results were observed between PQCDTB and PC61BM as well. When the PCZDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 4 , a smooth morphology was detected , and no fibril domain was observed , just like the PQCDTB , because the self - organization of PCZDTB is lower than that of PQCDTB. 9 In this study , PQCDTB has been successfully synthesized through the Suzuki coupling reaction by introducing planar quinacridone unit and a broad - absorption benzothiadiazole unit. PQCDTB had a high molecular weight and good thermal stability. Because of the appropriate HOMO and LUMO energy levels , an effective balance was produced. According to the X-ray diffraction measurement , a broad diffraction peak was observed at approximately 24.0 ° . In terms of the π-π stacking distance ( d π ) , a significantly shorter distance ( 3.7 Å ) was observed. These values were similar to the results of the thiophene and thiophenefused aromatic system polymers. When the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 1 , the highest efficiency was detected , and V OC , J SC , FF , and PCE were 0.79 V , 5.6 mA cm^-2 , 55.8% , and 2.5% , respectively. When the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 1 , the polymer formed a fibril - type domain and microphase separation occurred between the polymer and PC71BM. Because of selforganization , PQCDTB showed a higher FF compared with PCZDTB.

Let's think step by step.

1. Polymer
2. PCBM (specifically PC71BM)
3. PQCDTB
4. π-π stacking
5. PCZDTB
6. Thermal stability
7. HOMO and LUMO energy levels
8. X-ray diffraction measurement
9. Thiophene and thiophene-fused aromatic system polymers
10. Voc, Jsc, FF, and PCE

These are the material names mentioned in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

2. PCBM (specifically PC71BM)
3. PQCDTB

5. PCZDTB
6. Thermal stability

8. Thiophene and thiophene-fused aromatic system polymers
9. Voc, Jsc, FF, and PCE

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: To investigate the morphology of the polymer / PCBM blend film , atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was performed , and the result is shown in Figure 6. In Figure 6a , microphase separation occurred between the polymer and PC71BM , while the polymer formed a small fibril - type domain at a 1 : 1 PQCDTB / PC71BM ratio. As shown in Figure 6c , the fibril domain or microphase separation was clearer when measured at a 1 × 1 μm 2 size. It appears that this type of fibril domain occurred because PQCDTB formed effective π-π stacking based on outstanding crystallinity. 31 As shown in Figure 6b , in contrast , when the PQCDTB / PC71BM ratio was 1 : 2 , the polymers were assembled , and a large domain was formed. As a result , a relatively large - size phase separation took place. As shown in Figure 6d , the large domain or the large - size phase separation was clearer when measured at a 1 × 1 μm 2 size. The large - phase separation exhibits a low photocurrent by reducing the charge separation and increasing the exciton diffusion length and the recombination of electric charges. 32 Therefore , at a 1 : 2 polymer / PC71BM ratio , a large phase separation occurs between the polymer and the PC71BM. As a result , a low photocurrent would occur ; this is comparable to the 1 : 1 ratio. The same results were confirmed for the current device using the data in Table 3. Similar results were observed between PQCDTB and PC61BM as well. When the PCZDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 4 , a smooth morphology was detected , and no fibril domain was observed , just like the PQCDTB , because the self - organization of PCZDTB is lower than that of PQCDTB. 9 In this study , PQCDTB has been successfully synthesized through the Suzuki coupling reaction by introducing planar quinacridone unit and a broad - absorption benzothiadiazole unit. PQCDTB had a high molecular weight and good thermal stability. Because of the appropriate HOMO and LUMO energy levels , an effective balance was produced. According to the X-ray diffraction measurement , a broad diffraction peak was observed at approximately 24.0 ° . In terms of the π-π stacking distance ( d π ) , a significantly shorter distance ( 3.7 Å ) was observed. These values were similar to the results of the thiophene and thiophenefused aromatic system polymers. When the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 1 , the highest efficiency was detected , and V OC , J SC , FF , and PCE were 0.79 V , 5.6 mA cm^-2 , 55.8% , and 2.5% , respectively. When the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 1 , the polymer formed a fibril - type domain and microphase separation occurred between the polymer and PC71BM. Because of selforganization , PQCDTB showed a higher FF compared with PCZDTB.

Let's think step by step.

1. PQCDTB: A type of polymer synthesized through the Suzuki coupling reaction, which has a high molecular weight, good thermal stability, and appropriate HOMO and LUMO energy levels.
2. PC71BM: A fullerene derivative used in a blend with PQCDTB to form a polymer/PCBM blend film.
3. PC61BM: Another fullerene derivative similar to PC71BM.
4. PCZDTB: A type of polymer that has a lower self-organization compared to PQCDTB.
5. Polymer: A general term used to refer to PQCDTB and PCZDTB in the text.
6. AFM (Atomic Force Microscopy): A technique used to investigate the morphology of the polymer/PCBM blend film.
7. Microphase separation: A phenomenon where the polymer and PC71BM form separate domains in the blend film.
8. Fibril domain: A type of domain formed by the polymer, characterized by its small size and elongated shape.
9. π-π stacking: A type of interaction between aromatic rings in the polymer, which contributes to the formation of the fibril domain.
10. HOMO and LUMO energy levels: The highest occupied molecular orbital and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital energy levels of the polymer, which play a crucial role in charge transfer and exciton separation.
11. X-ray diffraction measurement: A technique used to measure the crystallinity and π-π stacking distance of the polymer.
12. Voc, Jsc, FF, and PCE: Performance metrics used to evaluate the efficiency of the polymer/PCBM blend film in solar cell applications.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. Molecular weight: Property of PQCDTB.
2. Thermal stability: Property of PQCDTB.
3. HOMO and LUMO energy levels: Properties of PQCDTB.
4. X-ray diffraction: Property of the polymer blend film, used to measure the crystallinity and π-π stacking distance.
5. π-π stacking distance: Property of the polymer blend film, measured using X-ray diffraction.
6. Morphology: Property of the polymer/PCBM blend film, investigated using AFM.
7. Microphase separation: Property of the polymer/PCBM blend film, indicating the formation of separate domains by the polymer and PC71BM.
8. Fibril domain: Property of the polymer/PCBM blend film, indicating the formation of small, elongated domains by the polymer.
9. Voc, Jsc, FF, and PCE: Performance metrics used to evaluate the efficiency of the polymer/PCBM blend film in solar cell applications.

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| --- |
| Molecular weight |
| Thermal stability |
| HOMO and LUMO energy levels |
| X-ray diffraction |
| π-π stacking distance |
| Morphology |
| Microphase separation |
| Fibril domain |
| Voc, Jsc, FF, and PCE |

Paragraph: To investigate the morphology of the polymer / PCBM blend film , atomic force microscopy ( AFM ) was performed , and the result is shown in Figure 6. In Figure 6a , microphase separation occurred between the polymer and PC71BM , while the polymer formed a small fibril - type domain at a 1 : 1 PQCDTB / PC71BM ratio. As shown in Figure 6c , the fibril domain or microphase separation was clearer when measured at a 1 × 1 μm 2 size. It appears that this type of fibril domain occurred because PQCDTB formed effective π-π stacking based on outstanding crystallinity. 31 As shown in Figure 6b , in contrast , when the PQCDTB / PC71BM ratio was 1 : 2 , the polymers were assembled , and a large domain was formed. As a result , a relatively large - size phase separation took place. As shown in Figure 6d , the large domain or the large - size phase separation was clearer when measured at a 1 × 1 μm 2 size. The large - phase separation exhibits a low photocurrent by reducing the charge separation and increasing the exciton diffusion length and the recombination of electric charges. 32 Therefore , at a 1 : 2 polymer / PC71BM ratio , a large phase separation occurs between the polymer and the PC71BM. As a result , a low photocurrent would occur ; this is comparable to the 1 : 1 ratio. The same results were confirmed for the current device using the data in Table 3. Similar results were observed between PQCDTB and PC61BM as well. When the PCZDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 4 , a smooth morphology was detected , and no fibril domain was observed , just like the PQCDTB , because the self - organization of PCZDTB is lower than that of PQCDTB. 9 In this study , PQCDTB has been successfully synthesized through the Suzuki coupling reaction by introducing planar quinacridone unit and a broad - absorption benzothiadiazole unit. PQCDTB had a high molecular weight and good thermal stability. Because of the appropriate HOMO and LUMO energy levels , an effective balance was produced. According to the X-ray diffraction measurement , a broad diffraction peak was observed at approximately 24.0 ° . In terms of the π-π stacking distance ( d π ) , a significantly shorter distance ( 3.7 Å ) was observed. These values were similar to the results of the thiophene and thiophenefused aromatic system polymers. When the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 1 , the highest efficiency was detected , and V OC , J SC , FF , and PCE were 0.79 V , 5.6 mA cm^-2 , 55.8% , and 2.5% , respectively. When the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio was 1 : 1 , the polymer formed a fibril - type domain and microphase separation occurred between the polymer and PC71BM. Because of selforganization , PQCDTB showed a higher FF compared with PCZDTB.

Let's think step by step.

1. Molecular weight of PQCDTB: high molecular weight.
2. Thermal stability of PQCDTB: good thermal stability.
3. HOMO energy level of PQCDTB: appropriate HOMO energy levels.
4. LUMO energy level of PQCDTB: appropriate LUMO energy levels.
5. π-π stacking distance of PQCDTB: 3.7 Å.
6. Voc (Open-circuit voltage): 0.79 V, when the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio is 1 : 1.
7. Jsc (Short-circuit current density): 5.6 mA/cm², when the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio is 1 : 1.
8. FF (Fill factor): 55.8%, when the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio is 1 : 1.
9. PCE (Power conversion efficiency): 2.5%, when the PQCDTB : PC71BM ratio is 1 : 1.

These are the identified values related to material properties in the given paragraph.
